description: Let d(n) = number of distinct primes dividing n (A001221); sequence gives t such that d(t)=d(t+1)=...=d(t+n-1) is a run of record length.
example: 54, 55, 56, 57, 58 is a run of length 5 in A001221 all with d = 2.
crossrefs: Monotonic subsequence of A048932. Cf. A048972.
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, _Enoch Haga_
extensions: More terms from Sam Handler (sam_5_5_5_0(AT)yahoo.com), Sep 04 2006
